comment: 50% of the exam questions did NOT reflect the material that he was teaching, so we basically had to teach ourselves to pass and felt unprepared for exams. He just read straight from the PowerPoint during lectures. Not only was the homework excessive, but it was also unhelpful. Using external learning materials like Quizlet was the only way to pass
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Pretty weird guy.  Went off on long tangents about super-specific topics in niche types of microbiology that we didn't need to know.  Lots of material to cover.

He is not very knowledgeable and when asked questions he will say that he does not know the answer. Plenty of times I was confused and asked for help, but he couldn't give it because he didn't know how to do the experiment. He grades very slowly. You have to do 2 posters for the class and he grades extremely harshly. Just choose somebody else.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects

comment: The best!! Just make sure to show up to class. hes super understanding and extremely helpful. He goes through all the info in class and does a demonstration as well. Make sure to keep up with assignment deadlines and youll be fine. He always answers questions and assists you with the lab if needed. Super helpful! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: A professor who cares if you understand or not. Takes time to explain the material and demonstrate the process. Always responds to email. More of a laidback, caring personality, but NOT a pushover. Makes labs fun and interesting without a lot of busy work. Gives helpful individual feedback in lab. No brainer, take his class if available.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This class shouldn't be online only, but he did a good job of presenting the powerpoints and being accessible. He's young and still getting himself in prof mode. All in all a cool guy and straightforward communicator, not mean or ulterior motives or bitterness like older instructors often have.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Just take notes each week and study and you will get an A. Its a lot of information but if you pace yourself then it is not hard to get through. The homework can be time consuming so do not put it off until the last minute. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Expectations are straightforward, and there is little to no interaction with Ryan. Simply prepare for exams by preparing thorough notes. I found this class highly interesting, and it has totally changed my career path!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: If you take him online, you will pretty much never talk to him or hear any feedback or reminders about anything ever. With that being said, it is possible to get an A. He does not make the class any harder than it has to be, no tricks involved. The tests are straightforward. Do the work and you'll be fine-- just know its only you and the material.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have Parker for both Lab and Lecture during the online covid stuff. He just uploaded all of his ppx with audio from last semester. He's pretty cool i guess but there was basically no interaction with him the entire semester so it's on you to get your grades. No lockdown and graded on Mastering/quizzes/tests. Goes hand in hand with Anatomy II
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: With COVID we were all online so you had to listen to recorded lectures with power points. That being said, his tests were so easy. Know the material, do the homework and you're fine. He doesn't try to trick you. Not exciting, but also not hard at all.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Easiest class ever online.

I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews on here. Just took his summer course and passed with an A+. Is the material hard? Yes. Do you have to study? Yes. Do your work and you will be just fine. It's just a lot of material, not super difficult. He is very responsive to emails and is willing to help you out. I would def take him again!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He is honestly a really nice and caring guy. I had him for Micro Lab and he was an awesome lab instructor. Now for lecture, not so much. Although I got an A, this class was very stressful. If you don't mind the extra workload then go for it!
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: Professor Parker is wonderful!! I always looked forward to his lectures. He is very consistent and always fair. He really cares about his students and goes above and beyond to help and answer questions. He is accessible outside of class and very responsive to emails.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: This class is not as bad as everyone is stating. He may have read the lectures word for word but he always told us what would be on the test. You literally just have to study your notes and read the book for an A. I promise you, these other reviews are scaring you for no reason. You just have to put in work like you would have to in A&P, but less.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: fall semester was his first time teaching and he mostly read of the powerpoint but he was super caring and he also curved the tests. Very nice guy. If you learn the powerpoints you will do fine in the class.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: A lot of what is said below is 100% accurate. He does read directly from the powerpoints, bases his tests from questions found online, and made the class more difficult than what it needed to be. I do not recommend taking him as a lecture professor because it is too much information compounded into the tests and will cause a lot of stress.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was painful when it truly didn't have to be. he is a very intelligent man, but he truly has no idea how to teach to anyone or make a test that is even slightly accurate to what he had taught. this class didn't have to be bad but he made it so hard that the people I sat next to changed their major and I know they weren't the only ones
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: I never imagined that micro would be the class to ruin my GPA. Professor Parker is truly a nice guy who knows what hes talking about, but he's just not good at teaching. Theres 2 test and a cumulative final. The homework is 15 chapter quizzes on d2l 10 questions each. Theres no way to get an A on the tests. He was a good lab teacher, however!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This instructor is dull and hard. His lectures are dry, hell just read from the PowerPoint. Most importantly though he creates the hardest test youll ever take in any of prerequisites classes. Ive finished all my pre-req my program and have never had test as hard as his. 3 exams- 70% of your grade. Not an easy A, better luck w/ other professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I was told micro would be one of my easier classes this semester, and he definitely made it THE hardest. We had 3 exams (2 unit test, 1 cumulative final.) Instead of Mastering HW, we had to complete a quiz per chapter on D2L. Keep in mind... theres 15 chapters! NO extra credit. Very small curves. If you want an A in this course, dont take him. :)
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: He's very knowledgeable, but he is not a good professor. His test are insanely hard despite him giving study guides-- he tends to go into much more detail on his test then he tells you he will in class. He reads straight off the slides in class and contradicts himself often.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Do yourself a favor and whatever you do, do not take him. This class could have been so much fun if done differently. He reads word for word 100+ slide powerpoints and theres only two tests and a final. I studied for hours and hours and this will be a class I will still get a B in. Nursing majors avoid for your sanity.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take him if youre trying to pass with A. Literally no teaching, all he did was read off the PowerPoint. Tests are super heavy with at least 4 chapter. Only 2 tests and 1 final exam, 15 quizzes for whole semester. If you fail first test, drop it because it doesnt get any better.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Two tests & a final. Each test over at least 5 chapters w/ each chapter being 100 powerpoint slides or longer. Tests very specific & only 50 questions. Reads ppt verbatim instead of actually teaching it. He had to give curves because of so many doing bad, but refused to give us other extra credit. Made an easy, fun class into a stressful one.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy
